DataElement.preferredName: Infectious Disorder Disease Marker Acceptable Outcome Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether or not the infectious disease marker (IDM) testing was within acceptable results.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Infectious Disorder Disease Marker Acceptable Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact._Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression._Satisfying an established set of qualifying measures._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.:Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Specific molecular signature of disease, physiological measurement, genotype structural or functional characteristic, metabolic changes, or other determinant that may simplify the diagnostic process, make diagnoses more accurate, distinguish different causes of disease, or enable physicians to make diagnoses before symptoms appear and to track disease progression.

Property.preferredDefinition: Satisfying an established set of qualifying measures.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Satisfying an established set of qualifying measures.
